data.title: Stevens garden & grill
data.text: I guess one could say I am a "charter customer" since they had just opened when I first visited. The food is always good and service is excellent. The different menus have been added as time goes on.

data.title: Hideaway in Mansfield
data.text: Little hidden away restaurant behind downtown Mansfield. Been going for years. Has music some nights. Big garden area for seating as well as smaller inside area.  Good food, cold beer. BBQ is above average but love burgers, tacos, nachos and quesadillas.

data.title: Best burger in Mansfield
data.text: For years I have contended that Steven's G&G has the best burger in Mansfield and that opinion still holds true today. I don't know exactly what it is but it could be the combination of the wheat bun, the spices and the fresh veggies they use. Along with a Shiner Bock beer, it's a meal to not contend with.

data.title: Best atmosphere with really good food
data.text: As a business owner, I know how hard it is to keep a exceptional reputation. Kudos to Stevens Garden and Grill. my favorite spot in Mansfield. David Hurd, Farmers Insurance, Mansfield

data.title: Food
data.text: Great stuffed jalapeños for an appetizer. They are loaded with cream cheese bacon and their spices. Excellent taste. The fish tacos were delicious. Blackened catfish with chipotle mayonnaise and pico de gallo. Their baked potato salad was outrageously fantastic. Definitely coming back here for the baked potato salad.

data.title: Nice setting, average food
data.text: There's a cute outdoor area to sit in. Food and service were ok, not outstanding. For the price food could have been better.

data.title: Great spot for food and family
data.text: First visit here was a success. Spacious outdoor patio seating. Greeted as we entered and seated quickly. Bar selections were good with local craft and domestics on tap. Other great choices in bottle and Margaritas available. Waiter was polite and timely. Food was very tasty. We had street tacos, fish tacos and sausage plate. All had great flavor and sides were good. Overall great experience and we will be back. Spread the word!

data.title: This is a hidden Gem!
data.text: The restaurant is a little hard to find in old town Mansfield but well worth it. The owners are active in the business and take a great deal of pride in what they do. The BBQ was outstanding and the pecan cobblers with ice cream, well do not leave without a bowl.

data.title: Great local-reasonably priced
data.text: Another great local restaurant in downtown Mansfield.  Have to search for it as off the main roads but well worth it.  Nice large patio.  Entertainment on some weekends.  Check website or call.  You'll smell the smoked meats before you walk in and the food tastes just as good. Haven't had anything bad and believe we've tried it all!!  Mexican chicken, jalapeño sausage, pulled piggy are the favs!!

data.title: Good Place to Visit with Friends
data.text: The patio area is very relaxing and a great place to sit with a group of friends and share good food and drinks.  Did not go on a night with live entertainment so cannot comment on that experience.   Love the wonderful shade trees and patio atmosphere.   Also nice to be off the main streets - loved the quiet!

data.title: Unique and relaxing place for dinner.
data.text: Great margaritas...!  Bbq was ok.  Fish tacos were good.  Never a long wait and friendly staff.  Nice to be tucked back behind things in downtown.

data.title: Hmm not my cup of tea
data.text: I'm not sure why this is sometimes called the hidden gem of Mansfield. I've been here twice now and the service has been soooo sloooow both times. Nevermind trying to have a business lunch here because you won't be able to get out in less than an hour. The food is just so so for me. It's barbeque and sides mainly. However, if you're going to do barbeque around here it better be to die for, melt in your moth, or something extra special because we have too many really great barbeque places within a 5 mile radius. I will say I've heard it's really nice to sit outside during the warmer months because it's pretty nice. So just to reiterate, this is not my favorite and I would call it an average place to eat in Mansfield.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text:
I SO want to support our local businesses, especially a small downtown like Mansfield.  We are frequent visitors to Steven's and love the outdoor patio but sadly the quality of the food is very much lacking these days. Gone are the days when we were greeted by the friendly owner Jan, instead it seems things have been placed in the hands of hired help and the passion just isn't there. 
On my last visit this week, I barely choked down a couple of bites of fatty, undercooked and very tough brisket. 
The sides were great.  The cobbler and ice cream awesome but when the star of the show isn't there, it leaves you very disappointed. 
I know this "joint" is much better than that!

data.title: Inconsistent
data.text:
A unique place that could be a real gem as downtown Mansfield finally starts to get going.  Unfortunately, the owners can't define what they want it to be.  Barbecue joint?  Steakhouse?  Burger joint?  Bar?  Family place?  You can't be everything, and the problems show.  Service is usually a mess, slow, and the food is inconsistent.

I think they should go for the Austin icehouse vibe, find a handful of menu items that are coherent, and get their staff in line.

We've lived in Mansfield almost ten years and are here often way back, but as inconsistency grew and choices expanded we drifted away.  The last visit might be the last, as the wait was long, the burger not good, and the barbecue dry.

data.title: Worst service and food in Mansfield
data.text:
Over cooked steaks rude service children running all over the place. Won't be coming back. I guess this used to be a  warehouse of some sort years ago  converted into a restaurant near the railroad tracks.

I noticed the owner was cooking on a makeshift charcoal grill inside the facility.
None the less I kept an open mind but its closed now

data.title: Good place for lunch
data.text: Small menu, but well done. The salads with chicken are really good, service is good, clean. Little hard to find, but worth it.

data.title: Yummy margarita's and street tacos
data.text:
Outdoor seating is great if it's not too hot. Yes the service is usually slow here but we've come to expect it. The margarita's are great and reasonably priced. Street taco's are a good value at only $9. Side portions are small. The meat plates are your best value here and that's really what they specialize in. My girls get nachos and there are always more chips than toppings to cover them.
The food has always been good, a bit pricey though for what you get. Very relaxed atmosphere so if you're in a hurry this probably isn't the place for you. The outdoor seating is also great for young restless kids. They can get up and move around.

data.title: Food is good but will not be going back
data.text:
The food was good, but for the price, nothing special.  They do have a large outdoor seating area, so if the weather is nice, that would be incentive to go here.  We went here to eat on the high recommendation of a neighbor.  The Mexican Chicken was good, but half the plate was filled with tortilla chips (no salsa).  My husband had the barbecue and said it was good, moist.

It is in an out-of-the way location in old Mansfield, which is nice.   Just so many fun and good choices of dining options in the area that I wouldn't choose to return here unless it was a lovely evening to sit outside and we were able to go early before they get really busy.

data.title: Nice Little Place
data.text: Stevens is a nice little mom and pop restaurant very close to downtown Mansfield. They have a nice variety of food selections it has great atmosphere. They also have live music on the patio on some nights. I see there are some bad reviews about the service but I have dined there more than a dozen times and have never had a problem. We highly recommend you give it a try.

data.title: Bad Service
data.text: We just got back from Stevens garden and grill tonight, so very disappointed. We had the worst service, it took over 20 minutes just to get any server to our table. I had to go to the hostess 2 times to find out if we even had a server. Once we did get a server it took an hour to get our food. We spent $142 for 6 people (2 kids in our party) which I don't mind spending for good service but this was awful. I've never in my life written a review it's too bad this was my first one, I'm very upset over the experience. Needless to say don't waste your time or money on this place. Too bad I couldn't rate is worse that Terrible!!! Stevens Garden you should be ashamed!!!
